meanings.definition: Fail to resist pressure, temptation, or some other negative force.
meanings.sent1: She kept succumbing to the urge to eat more cookies.
meanings.sent2: He succumbed to the peer pressure and made a poor decision.
meanings.sent3: The cat, succumbing to curiosity, knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The team succumbed to exhaustion after playing three back-to-back games.
meanings.sent5: The dam finally succumbed to the relentless force of the floodwaters.

meanings.definition: Die from the effect of a disease or injury.
meanings.sent1: Many patients succumb to the flu every year.
meanings.sent2: The injured bird succumbed to its wounds despite our efforts to save it.
meanings.sent3: The old car finally succumbed to rust and decay.
meanings.sent4: The tree succumbed to the harsh winter and fell during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The soldier succumbed to his injuries on the battlefield.
